name.ch: 微奈米材料暨元件技術導論

department.ch: 生醫科學與工程學系生物醫學工程碩士班
department.en: Master Program in Biomedical Engineering, Department of Biomedical Sciences and Engineering

goal.ch: 奈米科技是一門跨領域的學門，近來從科學領域的物理、化學、材料與電子等發展到生物醫學，其中的關鍵便是材料開發與元件設計的推進。本課程將針對奈米科技的幾個重點發展，包含奈米材料性質、製程、與元件設計原理分類講解、並將其重點應用在生醫感測領做通盤性的介紹。
goal.en: Nanotechnology is a cross-disciplinary subject. Recently, it has developed from physics, chemistry, materials and electronics in the scientific field to biomedicine. The key to this is the advancement of material development and device design. This course will focus on several key developments of nanotechnology, including classification and explanation of nanomaterial properties, manufacturing processes, and device design principles, and finally apply them into a comprehensive introduction to biomedical sensing Technology.

outline.ch:
1.奈米科技簡介
2.奈米材料性質-I
3.奈米材料性質-II
4.奈米材料性質-III
5.奈米元件分類簡述
6.微奈米元件製程-I
7.微奈米元件製程-II
8.文獻討論與實例分享
9.期中考試
10.微奈米元件製程-III
11.微奈米元件製程-IV
12.元件特性與操作原理介紹-I
13.元件特性與操作原理介紹-II
14.元件特性與操作原理介紹-III
15.奈米生醫感測元件-I
16.奈米生醫感測元件-II
17.文獻討論與實例分享
18.期末考試
outline.en:
Introduction to Nano Technology
2. Properties of nanomaterials -I
3. Properties of nanomaterials -II
4. Properties of nanomaterials -III
5. A brief description of the classification of nanodevices
6. Micro/Nano manufacturing process-I
7. Micro/Nano manufacturing Process-II
8. Literature discussion and case sharing
9. Mid-term exam
10. Micro/Nano manufacturing process -III
11. Micro/Nano manufacturing process -IV
12. Introduction to device characteristics and operating principles-I
13. Introduction to device characteristics and operating principles -II
14. Introduction to device characteristics and operating principles -III
15. Nanoscale Sensor in Biomedical Technology-I
16. Nanoscale Sensor in Biomedical Technology-II
17. Literature discussion and case sharing
18. Final exam

textbook.ch: 1. 半導體製程技術導論，蕭宏，第三版-全華。
textbook.en:
1.“D.A. Neamen,Semiconductor Physics and Devices”, 4th ed., McGraw Hill, 2011.
2.Handbook of Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology, Edited By Yoshio Nishi, Robert Doering, 2008.
